inn1.comm: on the pads, worked away behind square
well bowled, pushed across full outside off, drawing Imrul into pushing away from his body and gets beaten
decent carry, this rises from short of a length and is angled across past Imrul's outside edge as he plays a long way from his body
goes up and over the off side, gets a much better stride into this ball and lofts this well clear of the off-side ring
straightens the line, takes a thick outside edge but well wide of second slip and fine of third man who has to scoot around the boundary
full at off stump, defended with an open face towards backward point
full at off stump, Tamim comes forward and drives to point
back of a length outside off, left alone and decent carry through to Buttler
whips a full, straight delivery to square leg...playing around his front pad a bit, but there's not much swing, if any
too much on leg stump this time, flicked down to long leg
full at off stump, defended to mid-off
big appeal for lbw, more so by the bowler, as he whips across the line of a full delivery, falls across the shot, but it pitched outside leg
pushed across on a length outside off, holds his bat inside the line
wider outside off, left alone, and the umpire decides it's too wide...Woakes not entirely amused by the call. Did seem a touch harsh
short of a length outside off, defended at the top of the bounce behind square
gets forward on off stump, closes the face at a length delivery and works it backward of square on the leg side
goes for an expansive drive, his feet stuck in the crease, the ball comes off the bottom edge into the leg side
feeling for this a little outside off, seemed in two minds whether to just nurdle it or play a more attacking stroke, in the end it runs off the face to third man
angled across full outside off, left alone
smart batting, pushes a length ball into the off side and neither cover or mid-off can cut off the single
slower ball, full at off stump, driven to cover
short, but just tight enough to off stump that Tamim couldn't quite get his hands fully through the cut shot and picked out cover
fuller, on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
worked from outside off into the leg side
that's a fantastic stroke, dropped short by Ball and Tamim plays a one-legged whip-pull which whistles past square leg. Touch of a left-handed Greenidge in that

and now Imrul goes after the short ball, a slower one which sits up off the pitch, he's not entirely in control as it takes plenty of top edge but clears square leg and beats Rashid running around from long leg
defended to backward point
full and straight, played off the front foot to cover
goes up and over backward point with a cuts hot as Woakes is short outside off
nicely bowled, slides this one past the outside edge, short of a length and it may just have moved a fraction off the seam
this is full and a little wider, takes the outside edge as Tamim comes forward but it's safely towards ground and almost beats third man to his right
slower delivery at off stump, tapped to backward point
plays a short-arm pull off the front foot, wasn't that short by Ball, fetched over square leg...quite safe in the end
good comeback from the bowler as he gets back outside off and beats the outside
nearly drags this on as he plays a forcing shot off the back foot, takes a thick inside edge into his pads
almost a full-on bouncer this time, not great pace in the pitch and the ball only gets to shoulder height, hooked towards long leg
back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
he's much less certain outside off, fiddle and this one, which was fairly short, without any footwork and it nearly takes an edge to the keeper
on off stump, defended on the walk to cover
comes forward and drives firmly to mid-off
short again and this time he's timed sweetly over square leg as he has all the time in the world to play his pull
back of a length at off stump, defended to point
slower ball, very full, takes a bit of a leading edge but along the ground to mid-off
that's not overly smart from Ball, short again, more back-of-a-length, and Tamim swings it from outside off wide of mid-on
much fuller, at the stumps, punched firmly back to the bowler
short-of-a-length on the hip, worked behind square on the leg side
short of a length, outside off, ramps this down to third man...a well-controlled stroke
full outside leg stump, tucked to deep square
gets forward and defends a good-length ball to the off side
good start, in the channel outside off, don't think Tamim played at that, holding his bat behind the front pad
banged in short at off stump, Tamim can't quite bisect the gap between the men either side of point
full, outside off, defended to backward point
that's a good looking shot, comes forward into a full delivery and drives sweetly to cover
short of a length on the hip, worked behind square
tucks a straight ball in front of square off the front foot
turn straightaway...grips outside off and beats the outside edge
fraction shorter and straighter, allows him to go back and work it wide of mid-on
cuts without much conviction to point
goes back and knocks this towards mid-on
fuller, at middle and off, stretches forward and defends to cover
he can't take advantage of a short, wide delivery outside off as he punches it straight to cover
on the pads, deflects fine and Buttler manages to scramble across although can't prevent the ball from trickle away for a single
outside off, defended to backward point
length delivery, slower ball, dropped into the off side where cover is quickly in
gets forward, opens the face to a length delivery and it evades a diving backward point

what a stroke! He favours the leg side, but this has cleared the cover boundary. Used his feet on the line of leg stump, opened up the off side, and he launched a back-of-a-length delivery well over the fence
straighter delivery, defended to backward point
drives with an open face to point
goes back to a shorter delivery and drives through the covers
goes for the sweep, gets a top edge but it falls into space behind square
short outside off, rocks onto the back foot and drives to deep cover
full and straight, pushed to long-off
closes the face on a full ball angling into the pads and pushes through midwicket

he had to be alert here! Went for the pull, the ball ballooned off his body, he wasn't sure where it was for a moment, then made sure he protected his stumps in case the ball came down near them...gave it a little kick, too, to be safe
worked behind square, after a touch of uncertainty they collect the single
a bouncer, over leg stump, he ducks
gets inside the line of a back-of-a-length ball and tucks to long leg
full outside off, comes forward to drive, the bat twists in his hands a little so he loses timing on the shot
short of a length outside off, goes for the cut and the ball scoots over the top edge

appeal for a catch at slip as he goes for the reverse sweep. Given not out, and Buttler calls for the review. Wasn't an appeal full of conviction. Off the arm. Missed the glove on the way through. Should stay not out. And does
comes forward and drives to deep cover
simply driven down to long-off
shorter delivery, rocks back and punches with a straight bat wide of cover
touch short, again, but Tamin finds midwicket
fuller, that's a better length, he gets a good stride forward and blocks to the leg side
short of a length at leg stump, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he works through square leg
short outside off, gets on top of the bounce and angles it down to third man
gets underneath a swivel-pull off his hip, goes in the air for quite a long way but falls short of Rashid at long leg
slower ball, good variation from Plunkett, Tamin does well to adjust at the last minute and work it to third man...didn't bounce much
on leg stump, flicked through square leg
another slower ball, short of a length this time, defeats Tamim as he tries to play square on the off side
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
sweeps a straight delivery behind square...Duckett in the action on the boundary
full at the stumps, blocked to the off side
this grips, straightens on Tamim, he adjust at the last minute as he gets square up and an outside edge runs to backward point
very short, dragged down outside off, he escapes as Imrul finds cover
plays forward, takes a thick inside edge through the leg side
let's try that again, a slower ball is dragged down miles outside off, bounces twice through to Buttler
back of a length on off stump, the radar has been recalibrated, defended to point
touch fuller, on middle and off, defended square to the off side
was attempting something expansive, used his feet and went for a leg-side swipe, comes off near the splice of the bat and loops of mid-on
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
that's a well-controlled pull, rolls his wrists over the ball to keep it down and finds long leg
this pull is middled, gets up around chest height and he plays it behind square...confident stroke
short outside off, driven to cover
gets away with another short delivery, pushed towards cover and then there's confusion over whether the single is on offer...they both end up in the middle of the pitch
fuller, comes into the front foot and drives to deep cover
taps into the leg side
touch short again but he gets no timing in his stroke as the ball comes very slowly off the surface
brings him onto the front foot to end the over and pushes to mid-on
up on the toes, squirted down to third man for a single
banged in short, left alone outside off stump. Good tight line
onto the front foot, punched hard to short cover where Vince half-stops, but they steal the single anyway
outside off, that's a lovely line, through to the keeper with a solid leave
down the leg side. Attempted slower ball but on the wrong line
flogged into the covers, not quite timed
clipped off the pads, and there is the breakthrough! It was the cross-seamer from Stokes, just skidded on a touch and Dawson at square leg pockets a simple chance
outside off, full length, zips through to the keeper
short and wide, and that's a powerful square drive. Walloped out of the meat, and past the diving point
on the pads, flicked to short midwicket
back and across, defended out to point
short and swung off the legs, out to deep backward square
extra bounce from a tight line outside off, Tamim lines up the cut but he's beaten
advances down the track to flick off the pads
on the pads, pulled hard out to deep square leg.
opens the face to glide through third man
thumped into the covers to a loud shout of 'no!'
worked off the pads to midwicket. One more for Tamim to the milestone ...
up on the toes, tapped to cover
a gallop down the track and a big pirouetting slog out to midwicket
sliding down the leg side, Woakes was striving for swing that never materialised
pounded! That's a pugnacious stroke, onto the front foot, leaning back, swinging hard, and clubbing imperiously through long-on
up on the toes, angled bat to third man
clipped firmly off the toes, in the air for a while but always safe
beautiful shot, and what a way to reach 5,000 ODI runs! A genuine bouncer from Woakes, and a full-blooded swat off the eyebrows in front of square on the leg side! He nailed that
two fours in two balls as Woakes strays onto the pads to be milked through fine leg, and that's got the crowd jumping again!
down on one knee and swept to fine leg
onto the front foot, tapped out to point, and somehow there's a stolen single as a wild throw comes in from Plunkett. Moeen tidies up in the end
tossed up, outside off, and worked with the spin back to the bowler
forward and driven to cover
short and loose outside off, but it was the googly, and Tamim was already committed to a mow through the leg-side! He adjusts too late, pats a tame slap to cover, and the leggie has struck!
big spin from a perfect length! Sabbir is comprehensively beaten as he pushes down the line of the ball
solid line and length
short and pounded high and handsomely out through midwicket
extra lift from a tight line, defended out to cover off a leading edge. A bit dicey
short and hoicked round the corner, to backward square leg
worked off the toes out to backward square leg
slower ball, but nothing more or less than a 70mph long-hop outside off. Thumped through midwicket with gusto, and Bangladesh are ticking along nicely
more big spin but this time from outside leg. Strikes the pad with venom
a cautious crease-bound poke from another full-length turner. Probing work
more vigorous turn
banged in short and hoisted handsomely over midwicket! Buttler had just brought in a gully, and was rewarded with a long-hop!
gone! Another long-hop, sits up and begs, and Mahmudullah drove fiercely on the up, but straight to short cover!
forward to defend
tight line, angled into the pads, and defended
angled into the pads, whipped to short midwicket
swung through the leg side. Backward square gathers
banged in short, Mushfiqur hops across the crease to nurdle a single to fine leg
straying onto the pads again, but it's not a bad tactic with the current field. Another single to square leg
forward and deflected
big spin from outside leg, calmly pulled behind square
banged in short, hoisted over midwicket for four
on the pads, nurdled square
defended out to square leg
drilled into the covers
worked to midwicket with a cross-batted nurdle
short and sharp, Sabbir smells the leather as the ball fizzes by
tucked off the toes for another single
short again, too short this time. But the intent is clear
oops, it doesn't help that the Mighty Atom is knee-high to a daisy-cutter, but that's out of his reach too
on the pads, whittled into the leg side
flicked into the yawning gap at deep midwicket
too short, and pumped off the front foot to deep midwicket. Good intent
worked back to the bowler from a fuller length
solidly onto the front foot, and pushed to long-off
a massive swoosh outside off, and was that a drop from Buttler? It might well have been ... will try to confirm
big spin again, worked into the covers
shorter length, but skids on. Defended with an angled bat on the back foot
tossed wide outside off...too wide
worked with the spin for another single
blotted to cover, and Woakes' shy is wild, to gift Bangladesh another overthrow. There have been a few of those today
turn from off to leg, works with the spin for another single to square leg
attempted reverse sweep, doesn't connect, but does enough to distract Buttler behind the stumps
nudged off the pads for another single
tucked to midwicket
flicked off the pads, no-one at leg gully so a perfectly safe shot
whoops, out comes Moeen's trademark waist-high full-toss, and that is gleefully slammed through midwicket to bring up Bangladesh's 150!
tucked off the toes to midwicket
another big legbreak, but short enough for Mushfiqur to adjust and dab into the gap at point
this one skids on, and that's a well-timed cut to backward point
crunched into the covers, finds the gap with good placement
leaping turn from an off-stump line. Left alone
right under the eyeline and driven on the up to long-off
round the wicket, that's a very clever flick over the shoulder, down on one knee and ramping to fine leg
forward and blocked
on the pads, that is superbly played, just hopping inside the line at the last split-second and easing the ball so fine. No cutting that off!
pounded hard, lots of bottom hand, to long-on
worked into the leg side
another flick into the gap at midwicket. Bangladesh keep marching on
big stride onto the front foot, and pushed to cover
solid block, back down the wicket
forward and nudged out to cover
tapped to short cover, and another quick single. Good judgement
big spin, little edge, and another Bangladesh batsman falls in the 40s! Dragged forward to a perfect-length legbreak, and Buttler does the rest
defends his first ball from outside off, turned back at the left hander
full outside off, clipped to long-on
round the wicket and that's a beauty, grips enough to spin past the outside edge
touch fuller, allows him to get forward and cover for the turn, opens the face into cover
goes back and dabs to short third man
worked out to deep square leg
defended off the back foot
touch short on leg stump, goes back in his crease and nudges to the leg side
worked off the pads into midwicket, almost confusion over the running while Bairstow also slips as he gets to the ball

sharp work down the leg side from Buttler as he gathers this one which spins sharply. Called a wide and they just double check to make sure Shakib stayed behind the line. Very muted appeal. Yes, he's back. Was out for a fraction of a second
tossed wide outside off, expansive drive without much footwork takes a thick edge
drives again, finds cover
plays this neatly behind square, turned quite sharply, he wait for it and flicked wide of leg slip
sweeps a straight delivery to deep square leg

he'll be out stumped here! Bounces back off Buttler's gloves and Shakib is just out of his ground. Was a lovely delivery, spun to beat the edge as he played forward, the bails came off and there was some confusion. Went upstairs, confirmed it wasn't bowled. Buttler didn't glove it but got lucky with the rebound and Shakib couldn't push his foot back over the line. Buttler, himself, wasn't even sure. For a moment I think he thought he'd fluffed it.
goes back to his first ball and works through square leg
more significant spin, the line was outside off this time, dabbed with soft hands
a straighter line and spins down the leg side...always think that's a touch harsh for a spinner
back outside off, played down off a thick inside part of the bat and that's not far from the stumps
full outside off, flicked to deep midwicket
tucked behind square off the pads and that's good running to make it a second
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
gives himself a touch room, opens the stance, drives down to long-off
driven to short cover, he held this one back a bit
nicely bowled, drifts into leg stump then turns, takes a leading edge to the off side
touch shorter, on off stump, defended
that's a ripper! This pitches outside leg and beats the outside edge. He played back and ended up almost square-on to the bowler
leans forward and taps to cover
fraction shorter outside off, he late cuts and finds short third man
gets cramped for room as this one spins, playing to the off side
gets a stride across his crease, goes right outside off stump, works this into square leg with the spin
cut to short third man
flicked firmly to midwicket...that completes Moeen's 10 overs

he's got four! And it's another a not-so-great-delivery. He's clubbed a low full toss to midwicket. He did dip on him quite late, which may have caused him a problem, took the toe end for a simple catch
another full toss, on the pads, clipped along the ground to deep midwicket
comes forward and plays to cover
shorter outside off, he waits and cuts but finds point
opens up the off side by staying just outside leg stump, there's a bit of leading edge about the lofted drive but it's safely into space between cover and long-off
this one is a bit more dangerous, slices across the line of a full ball as he aims down the ground...bounces short of long-off
on a length outside off, opens the face to third man
beats the edge as he comes forward and drives...wasn't full of conviction
slower ball, full outside off, pushed to backward point
a bouncer, of the slower-ball variety, Mosaddek ducks and it skims close to his helmet
out with a direct hit, but Bairstow misses...he flicked a back-of-a-length ball to midwicket, Mushfiqur raced off for a run that wasn't there
cut to deep cover
another beauty, drift, grip and it spins past the outside edge...Warne would have been proud of that one
driven to long-off
a shorter delivery, pushed off the back foot to midwicket...more uncertainty in the calling
another one rips past the edge! Lovely stuff from Rashid. Drifts outside leg stump then spins across the face of the bat
outside off this time, allows him to drive to deep cover and Rashid not thrilled it was a couple
flat-batted drive to deep cover...that's Rashid's spell done and it's a career-best for the second time in three matches
on a length, pushed to cover
worked from off stump to the leg side
short outside off, he arches his back and upper-cuts to third man
flayed over backward point and connects well enough to get the boundary, wasn't in control and Stokes may have got fingertips on it as he leapt...first boundary for 61 balls
and he breaks the shackles with back-to-back fours, this is a club across the line at a back-of-a-length delivery which goes straight down the ground. Stand and deliver. Crowd is alive again
short again, a slower ball this time, angled to third man
pushed to backward point
plays across the line of a full ball, takes the pad but going down the leg side
opens the face down to third man
back of a length outside off, good cricket as he drops into the off side and nabs the single
comes down the pitch, it's a slower ball, he steers it to backward point
gets the yorker in, dug out to midwicket...good over by Stokes
back of a length, angled down to third man
moves the leg side and shovels to the leg side, Bairstow is in from midwicket and misses the non-striker's stumps with his under-arm flick
lofted over the off-side in-field, wide of the sweeper
angled into the pads, flicked to long leg
defeated by a short-of-a-length slower ball, he's through his shot early aiming to hoick to leg
opens the face to third man
strong bottom hand comes into play as he flicks a near-yorker wide of midwicket and long-on
that's a poor ball, a slower delivery dragged down the leg side, but he gets away with just the single to long leg...would have been a wide if left alone
this one is called wide, to Buttler's disgust...Mushfiqur moved a long way across the crease and went for the scoop. Not far from leg stump
full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off
length ball outside off, gave himself a bit too much room to leg and was left reaching for it
short, down the leg side, another wide
swing and a miss outside off again
full at off stump, driven down the ground
just short of mid-off! Moved outside leg and heaved at a short-of-a-length ball, skimmed towards Woakes who did well to cut if off in the end
tries to scoop this, a full straight delivery, and it comes off the toe end to midwicket
that's well played, moved to the leg side a touch then used Plunkett's pace to angle it fine down to third man
fuller, straighter, tucked off the pads through square leg and they scamper back for the second
worked off the stumps to midwicket
driven off the stumps to the covers
full outside off, reaches for it, takes the bottom off the bat, squirted to third man
width again, he upper cuts to third man and it's not far from carrying all the way to the fielder
full outside off, he's staying leg-side of the ball, swings at fresh air
slower ball, full and straight, dabbed to the off side
dropped, by Stokes! You won't see that often. He got too far underneath his attempt to hit straight, had more height than distance, Stokes got round from long-on then shelled it
and it's costly already! He's middled this one for sure. Swings through the line of a length ball and dispatches it well into the stands at deep square. What a way to reach fifty
moves across outside off, tries to scoop, misses
gets the yorker in, well bowled, dug out back to the bowler
gets the yorker on target again, at leg stump, gets driven to cover
slower delivery, on a length, heaved to long-on
low full toss, at the pads, he makes good connection and backs it up with the placement to bisect long leg and deep square leg
gives himself room outside leg and runs it down to third man to keep the strike
width outside off, throws his hands into a drive but it comes from quite low on the bat...straight to deep cover
that's a superb stroke, wide outside off again and there are some strong wrists on show as he slices it through backward point
slower ball, outside off, this time he picks out backward point
swings across the line, down on his back knee, gets a bottom edge into his pads
he likes backward point, this time he goes up and over, offered too much width on a hitable length, carts it wide of third man
goes full and Mosaddek goes straight, a strong club, Stokes gets around from long-on but the flick back to his team-mates goes a little wrong. England under pressure
slower ball, banged in, swatted to deep square leg
that's brilliant! Gets the scoop right on this occasion, flicks a full, straight delivery off the stumps and almost straight over the keeper's head
low full toss, heaved down the ground
slower ball, short delivery, he cloths it to short fine leg as he tries to pull it fine
short, over off stump, swing and miss from the Mighty Atom (who has been Mighty today)
can he finish with a boundary? Not quite...spears a full ball behind point, Duckett races round from third man and manages to flick it back

inn2.comm: outside off, tight line and just a hint of movement off the seam. Good carry through to the keeper
outside off, and a slightly fat edge into the gully
back of a length, tight line, worked with the angle off the back foot to short midwicket
solid line and length once more, and an even more solid face-faced defensive push back down the line of the ball
back of a length once more, defended from the crease into the leg side. Tight line throughout this over
driven into the covers. And that is a maiden to launch the innings!
sliding down the leg side
clipped off the toes out to midwicket
tapped into the leg side
lovely strike, just a nugget of width, and a roll of the wrists through the covers.
forward, poked to mid-off. Thoughts of a single, swiftly declined
good shape back into the right-hander, eased to mid-on who shies underarm
back of a length once more, but ever so tight to off stump. Defended down to third man
good delivery, leaving the batsman outside off
shorter but sharper, Billings climbs into a cut but finds thin air
on the pads, worked to backward square leg
punched off the back foot into the gap in the covers. Tidy placement
tapped into the leg side
advances down the track to meet the ball outside off stump, and clipped to midwicket
short, but gets away with it as Billings' fierce pull goes straight to short backward square. A yard either side...
flicked in the air but in front of that man on the leg side. Deep square leg tidies up
up on the toes and pushed to cover
back of a length, and pounded out to deep square leg
onto the front foot, attractively played, but straight to mid-off
tremendous strike, up on the toes, drilled hard into the gap in the covers. Not stopping that one
dangled outside off stump, and inside-edged down into the crease. Lucky not to chop on there, as the ball bounces over the stumps
tight line once more, taking pace off the ball, and demanding a respectful dead-batted defence

outside off, glided down to third man, and this must surely be a run out! No! The shy goes wild, after Billings has collided with Mortaza. That could have been a tricky decision if the stumps had been broken. No backwards steps from either man, as promised by England's coach. This is going to get feisty!
good riposte, leaning onto a drive, clean through long-on
utterly spanked, but straight to short cover. Vince holds the pose in his followthrough, as well he might. One of the best shots for none you will ever see
round the wicket, tossed up slowly onto a middle and leg line. Blocked
Billings advances, and Shakib gets some big rip off the deck. Takes a thick outside edge to gully
forward and defended
width outside off, and slashed hard through third man
defended from a good length
dabbed out to point
worked to leg once again
down the track and drilled hard and straight back past the bowler
outside off, cut hard to point
another single into the covers
inside-edged drive to midwicket
back of a length, eased to point
ambitous sweep, way down the track, but wears it on the visor as the ball bites
solid drive to long-off
solid defence into the covers. That's the arm ball, slides on
makes room outside leg to drive to long-off for another single
solid block from round the wicket. Good probing line and length
lovely teasing flight through the air, defended
pushed onto the back foot, angled into the pads
a bit of a mow across the line, but the ball was short enough to get away with it. Midwicket gathers
down on one knee, and Billings nails this one, helped round the corner through fine leg. Well played
bang! Have some of that! Billings has suddenly found his range, and that was pounded over backward square! Into position early for the sweep, and leathered!
attempted cut, rebounds off the keeper
outside off, pushed back to the bowler
thumped to cover
spins sharply but keeps very low. Left alone
tossed in towards the toes, wheedled to backward square
driven into the covers
more probing line and length
chiselled into the leg side
tapped off the back foot to cover, and that is the fifty stand
outside off, through to the keeper, good extra bounce
well placed. A back-foot punch, opened the face and timed the pants off it, through the gap at backward point
tremendous strike once more, a fierce drive through the covers as Taskin over-corrects his length. A flailing diving effort in the outfield, but the ball wins
opens the face, glides down to third man
defended to gully, another sharp single
big offbreak, worked off the pads
flicked uppishly to mid-on
huge appeal! That was spinning and would surely have hit the stumps, but Vince was well outside the line on his sweep

gone this time! Vince walks across his stumps to one that doesn't turn so much, and that is plumb! Looking to work a single off the pads, but struck in front. He thinks of reviewing, but thinks better of it
onto the front foot, driven calmly to cover
back of a length, cracked ambitiously into the covers, but with no timing. The end of an eventful over
flicking to leg
worked into the gap to get off the mark
down on one knee for a firm sweep to fine leg
forward and pushed to cover
solidly blocked from deep in the crease
slides on and strikes the pad, but that was heading down the leg side. Tidy over though ...
skids on and turns sharply, and Billings nearly scoops a startled defensive push to mid-on
round the wicket, angled into the left-hander, and drilled to cover
opens the face to drive into the covers
reverse sweep, and that's beautifully played - timing and placement. Backward point makes good ground but his dive can only parry the ball onto the rope

on the pads, a sharp single, and that's a bit of a desperate dive! This could be close! A direct hit would have been curtains, but Duckett's dive just beats Mushfiqur's incoming gloves .... It's a photo finish!
down the track and defended
spinning from off to leg, and met with a full face and a push to long-on
outside off, cut through backward point
worked to the leg side
a loose-wristed flog into the leg side
down the track and eased to wide long-on. That is Billings' ODI best
driven hard, but straight to cover
reverse sweep again, another good piece of timing and placement as backward point runs round to gather
blam! A big stride, drops to one knee, and launched into the stands!
forward and pushed to cover
inside-out lofted drive into the covers. That's another nice shot, and well saved with a slide on the boundary
good delivery, fuller length, biting on pitching, and defended
solid push to long-off for another single
down the track, tapped to midwicket
biffed out to wide long-on with oodles of bottom hand
down the track, and clipped to square leg
opens the face to run another single down to third man
grips from round the wicket, straightening towards middle stump, and defended
clipped into the covers, England going along nicely for now
outside off, pushed into the covers off a leading edge
round the wicket, Duckett loops himself into the reverse sweep, and pings his shot down to backward point
worked into the leg side
forward and flicked into space on the leg side
that's brilliant, dinked behind square with power and timing. No cutting that off
onto the front foot, pushed down the ground.
plays with the spin, tucked to short leg
started too straight and pushed down the leg side
takes this from outside off into the leg side
drops it short outside off, cut to deep point
opens his stance a touch drives to cover
slides onto leg stump, clips the pad and runs very fine past the keeper - actually, Billings got a tickle on that
opens the face and places it into the off side, takes him to his maiden ODI fifty...super effort
full outside off, Billings plays over the top of the ball
well bowled, zips off the surface from back of a length and beats the edge as Billings feels for it without any footwork
walks across the crease and down the pitch, makes this a fuller delivery that it was, pushed to the covers
full at off stump, played to cover
now he beats Duckett, pushed across on a full length and he's feeling for it
clipped off the pads and picks out square...good comeback from Taskin
back of a length, gets on top of the bounce and punches to deep cover
leading edge, short of cover! Was full on leg stump, there to work away, it was actually a cutter which gripped, so credit to the bowler, and he nearly defeated Duckett
driven firmly towards mid-off inside the circle but they scamper through

huge appeal for lbw! Billings right across his crease, given not out and they review. Hit Billings get outside the line of off stump. Similar to the review against Buttler in the previous game. He is a long way down the pitch for starters. But it looks fairly straight. Well, it's umpire's call on hitting in line so will stay not out
driven square of the wicket to the sweeper
pushed down the leg side, he'll have to bowl that again
back onto off stump, full, driven to the covers
drives and misses outside off, just a hint of shape away
sharp fielding! Punched into the covers, Shakib dived across at cover, one-handed, collected the ball and threw towards the stumps but Billings was safe...brings up the 50 stand
full and straight, punched back to the bowler
back of a length, defended to cover
shorter, he plays a slightly crouched pull to deep square
that's a lovely stroke, uses his feet and drills it straight - so straight that it crashes into the stumps and probably costs him a boundary
that's a bit more ugly, but he gets four...so much for hitting the lovely shots! He came down the pitch, heaved at a ball wide outside off and got a top edge down to third man
uses his feet again, and is beaten by a terrific delivery which seams and bounces outside off...good carry to the keeper
straighter, tucked off his pads to deep square
defeated by one that doesn't bounce quite as he expected outside off, cuts over the top of it
tucks a back-of-a-length ball through straight midwicket
fetches a short ball from outside off, takes a bit more top edge that middle but he's picked plenty of space of the leg side towards deep midwicket
good length outside off, punched strongly to mid-off
very short outside off, perhaps a little lucky to get away with that
well bowled, extra bounce from back of a length, takes the splice of the bat towards point
uses his feet, defends a back-of-a-length delivery...this is good stuff from Taskin
short outside off, does very well to roll his wrists and keep his pull down because the ball was quite high, sends it wide of deep square
well bowled, hangs it outside off and skids this past the outside edge as Billings walks at the bowler
starts short but gets away with as Duckett pulls to midwicket
goes down early for the sweep, ball was a touch wide so he had to fetch it, kept it along the ground to deep square
that's the breakthrough! Goes for the sweep, takes the top edge and settles into the hands of deep square leg
fraction short, means he can wait for it to turn off the back foot and push to long-on...worth having the man up to the new man?
angled in at the pads, flicked to short fine leg who fumbles to allow a single
flicked from full outside off down to long-on
will feel he missed out, was short and wide, cut straight to point
beaten, going for a late cut, was quite tight to off stump
full and straight, hint of shape, dug out off the toe to the leg side...Bairstow inspects the bottom of his bat
short of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
full at off stump, nicely driven straight, Taskin gets his right hand to it
back of a length, tucked towards mid-on
over the wicket, goes for the slog-sweep and he gets it just over the man inside the circle at midwicket
uses his feet, defends
pushes down the ground to long-off
flicked into midwicket
worked down the ground to long on
slow-sweep again, this time it's a big top edge, falls into space wide of long-on...Duckett keen not to let Nasir settle
wide line outside off, draws Bairstow forward
dab-sweeps a very full ball from outside off and races back for what, with his speed between the wickets, is an easy two
switch his line to round the wicket, Bairstow responded by using his feet on the line of leg stump then lofted with excellent timing - not brute force - over mid-off
worked down to long-on
good footwork from Duckett this time, opening up the off side, drives inside-out wide of long-off
brings out the reverse sweep, ball was probably around off stump, finds deep point
flicked to midwicket
quite a round-arm delivery, slung towards leg stump, he picks out midwicket again
very delicate, he almost takes off the keeper's head his dab-sweep is so fine, short fine leg is able to catch up with it
pushed into the leg side
on the pads, flicked to deep square
huge appeal for lbw as he misses a sweep, glances off the pad through third man...was outside the line of off stump. Oh, given runs as well. Not sure he hit it. Anyway.
full at middle and off, pushed to the covers
cut through point...takes him to his second fifty of the series. Greeted with a wall of silence.
opens the face down to third man
round the wicket, tight to off stump, a wristy drive finds point
full, angled in at middle and leg, can't get it wide of midwicket
tight line, no width to work, can only drive to cover
round the wicket, full and straight, driven to long-off
swept with a lot of power, taken from outside off and it's drilled square of the wicket...wasn't far from deep square, who managed to get a hand on it, but couldn't haul it in
that's very smart cricket, saw that mid-off was up so used his feet and lofted it, one bounce, to the long-off rope
and now he sweeps again, along the ground, straight to deep square
tight run! Thick inside edge to the leg side, Mushfiqur races after it and that would have been Duckett run out with a hit
worked out to deep midwicket
back of a length from round the wicket, driven to deep cover

knocked him over! Shafiul does the trick. A rather ugly stroke from Bairstow, went for a pull to a back-of-a-length delivery, he had used his feet, too, so made the ball fuller to start with. Takes off stump
good length at off stump, pushed to deep cover
round the wicket, driven to cover
he nearly makes Bairstow's mistake, pulling at a length ball, but gets a bottom edge between his legs
full and straight, punched straight of mid-off...there's a direct hit but no one seems that excited. Comfortably home
full at middle and off, gets forward and blocks firmly to mid-off
short of a length on the hip, plays an uppish, jabby pull towards deep square
heaves a length ball from off stump to deep midwicket
gets forward and defends
full at middle, defended back to the bowler
nudged into the off side, a tight single but a thumbs up from Duckett at the end
back of a length, straight, flicked towards mid-on...runs required into double figures now
he's struck again! He's scooped it to the keeper. Went across his crease outside off, aimed to scoop it towards fine leg but ended up getting a little tickle and Mushfiqur pulled off a superb catch
flicked easily out to deep midwicket
on the pads, a slower ball. Stokes waits, and works it to midwicket
short and shovelled through square leg. Not desperately short, but read the length like a comic book. Chittagong goes silent once again
onto the front foot, better line and length, eased to mid-off
overthrows ... a gentle push, but a rather wild shy. Mashrafe is unimpressed
outside off, and punched out to deep midwicket
back of a length, and clubbed on the up to mid-on
an easy push to cover but that's a sharp grab with one hand. Thoughts of pinching a single but they think again
pushed uppishly into the covers again
outside off, and chipped on the up, over mid-off to trickle into the rope. A pitching wedge onto the green
clubbed into the covers
walks across the stumps, attempted nurdle to leg, but ends up at mid-on
slower ball, good line outside off, they pinch a quick single to cover, and there's a quick glance at a replay as the shy hits the stumps. But the batsman is only about four feet into the crease...
clipped on the up to midwicket
blotted into the off side
whipped off the toes to deep midwicket
round the wicket, slammed back to the bowler who briefly fumbles but prevents the run
eased down to long-off
flicked firmly to long-on
lamped to deep point, lots of intent but not much timing right now
more violent intent as Stokes winds into a slog-sweep but deep midwicket is well placed. Up comes the 200
good finish, Defended back to the bowler from a probing line and length
round the wicket, skids on with the arm and slams the back pad
very full, targetting the toes, and flicked to wide long-on
lured out of the crease, inside-edged drive to midwicket
reverse sweep, and that is a brilliant stroke. Picks off the gap with power and placement behind square
down the leg side
on the back foot, and defended back to the bowler
another reverse-sweep, but this time backward point is alert
thumped to long-off
back of a length, turning into the hip, and helped square
attempted mow across the line, but this is the one that just slides on, and Buttler is beaten on the slog
punched off the back foot to deep cover
utterly blattered over long-on! A gallop down the track, meeting the ball as it pitches, and though it spins sharply, Stokes' violent blade wins that argument!
tapped into the off side
inswinging into the pads, defended into the leg side
banged in short, short-arm hoick to the leg side
fully forward and poked to the off side
slides down the leg side, but clips the thigh to prevent the wide
slower ball, well picked and drilled hard to mid-on, who makes good ground to intercept
back of a length, defended
thumped to deep cover, good running to turn for the second
short, wide, slapped through point. Hear that silence!
back of a length, and struck so straight and sweet that middle stump at the non-striker's end fields
short, slow, and Buttler has chopped on! That was nothing more than a long-hop outside off, but it got up more than Buttler was expecting, and he has given Bangladesh a glimmer!
short-arm pull out to deep midwicket to get off the mark
on the pads, flicked to midwicket
tight defence, back down the pitch
that is a snorter! Full length, swinging and seaming off the deck, and climbing past a loose poke. Can't lay a bat on that!
slower ball, down the leg side, Stokes was primed to beast that into the stands, but restrained himself at the last split-second and accepted the extra
more seam movement, but from a leg-stump line. Eased off the hip to backward square
outside off, and a swing and a miss. Good line, forcing Stokes to reach for it
on the pads, and windscreen-wiped to midwicket. The bat did a full arc after making contact, if you don't believe me ...
full length, and clipped to mid-on
back of a length, a slower ball. Stokes waits and works a single off his hip
defended

good grief, that is as soft as a freshly laundered duck-down pillow! Moeen has chipped a catch so tame to mid-on that it might has well have said woof and begged for a doggy-drop on the way down! It was full length, angled into the pads, and he somehow got right underneath his stroke. Mahmudullah merely had to back-pedal two paces
worked out to point off the back foot
tight line and length, on the off stump. Defended
outside off, cut to backward point. And Mashrafe has clawed his side back into the contest!
edged, but safely played - deliberately played. Thrust his edge outside the line and beat Rahim behind the stumps
punched off the back foot, and mid-on is beaten. A long chase to retrieve and three more vital runs
very full, an outswinging yorker. Taskin grabs with one hand in his followthrough
on the pads, inswinging but outside the line
deflected to third man
eased off an open face to deep backward point
onto the front foot, pushed to mid-off
outside edge, squirted down to third man. Taskin is miffed that they got away with two there
outside off, pushed hard to short cover
angled into the off stump, squirted to gully
another single, working the gaps well
a leading edge on an attempted clip to leg
tight line and length, Stokes leans forward to defend
outside off and that was so close to the edge! Stokes drove on the up but wasn't quite to the pitch of the ball. The Mighty Atom grimaces behind the stumps
clubbed to long-on for another single
lovely bowling, an offcutter, and nibbles through the gate and just past off stump. So close!
well bowled again, a loose drive from Woakes and he's beaten again. This is turning into a fine over. Can Shafiul close it out?
outside off, and worked off a thick edge to third man. Excellent bowling. Shafiul has one more to come, and another of that tightness will make things very interesting!
tight line and length, met with a compact drive and a good committed tumbling dive at mid-on. One more to the total
on the pads, clipped to midwicket, one more to the total ...
what a strike! A big stride and spanked triumphantly through the covers! I can hear my ears pop as Chittagong draws all of the air out of the stadium
dropped! Is that the series, there and then?! Mashrafe brought the slip into place, and Imrul got the chance that his country needed. But he muffed it! Chest height, and eminently catchable
through to the keeper once more. Two dots, at least, for Bangladesh's sake
driven in the air, but too much power to be stopped by a flying short cover! Drama all over the shop, but England emerge with the upper hand
down the track, Stokes has had enough of this nonsense. A belligerent thwack, high into the night sky, and over long-on!
fuller length, pumped out to deep midwicket, and back they come for two. Single figures needed now
it's going wrong now. An attempted variation, but it barely hits the cut strip
tighter line, dead-batted to cover and Stokes jogs the single
down the leg side. Shafiul has given up the ghost now
good delivery, cutting back into the right hander, who pokes from deep in the crease to defend
up, up and away, Woakes gets right underneath a lofted drive, clears the long-off boundary, and that is the series!
